definition: to fix a date (for an event)/to select an auspicious date
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
to pick an auspicious day

sentences.english: Both boys pleaded guilty to the theft charge and face sentencing at a later date.
sentences.chinese: 这两名男孩对该偷盗指控供认不讳，并将被择日宣判。

sentences.english: As drunk by James Bond in the film "Die Another Day".
sentences.chinese: 这是让詹姆斯邦德在电影“择日而亡”中喝醉的酒。

sentences.english: Court of second instance will choose a sentencing date.
The judge states collegiate bench closes this case adjudicates choose an auspicious day after discussing.
sentences.chinese: 法官表示合议庭合议后将择日宣判此案。

sentences.english: This boss carefully selected this day to celebrate the big opening of his new restaurant close to Beijing Road.
sentences.chinese: 这个老板择日为在北京路附近的新餐厅举行开张庆典。

sentences.english: The court has choose an auspicious day adjudging to this case.
sentences.chinese: 法院将择日对该案进行宣判。

definition: propitious day/lucky day
fine time, lucky day (idiom); fig. good opportunity
to select
to pick an auspicious day
religious ceremony/ritual
to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
the day after tomorrow/from hence/from now/from now on/henceforth
to make a decision/to determine
to pronounce a sentence (after a verdict in a court of law)
casting a couple's fortune based on their bithdates (old)
within the next few days/in a few days time
matters/arrangements
tomorrow
public trial (in a court of law)
to hear a case again/review/retrial
to open a law court/to set up a mourning hall
